program.name: python -m ep_bolfi.kadi_tools.eis_parameterization
program.description: Please refer to the --help output of this file.

param.description: Persistent record identifier of the record with the optimizer input.
param.name: input-record

param.description: File name of the optimizer input file.
param.name: input-file

param.description:
File name of the model parameters. It must be a Python file and contain the following global variables:
- parameters: The dictionary of parameters to pass on to the solver. May be a ep_bolfi.utility.preprocessing.SubstitutionDict.
- unknowns: The dictionary of unknown parameters. Instead of single values as in 'parameters', input 2-tuples with their lower and upper bounds, e.g. from literature.
It may contain the additional following global variables:
- transform_unknowns: Dictionary for transforming unknowns before inferring them via a normal distribution. Either give as 2-tuples with the first entry being the back-transformation and the second one being the transformation. For convenience, putting 'log' gives log-normal distributions.
- negative_SOC_from_cell_SOC: A callable, used for OCV subtraction.
- positive_SOC_from_cell_SOC: A callable, used for OCV subtraction.
- uncertainties: The dictionary of parameter uncertainties. Used for scrambling them in the simulation samples. Give them as tuples: the first entry is the name of the distribution in scipy.stats, and the following are its parameters. Example: ('norm', mean, std).
param.name: parameters-file

param.description: Persistent record identifier of the record to store the output of the optimizer in.
param.name: output-record

param.description: Seed for RNG. Set to a number for unvarying results.
param.name: seed

param.description: Whether or not an already existing file by the same name in the record gets overwritten.
param.name: overwrite
